intro: Senecillis platyglossa, commonly known as the broad-tongued lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-like, broad leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short rhizome, which help it thrive in woodland environments.
